issue.title: tool: use our own stderr variable

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Earlier this year we changed our own stderr variable to use the standard
name `stderr` (to avoid bugs where someone is using `stderr` instead of
the curl-tool specific variable). This solution needed to override the
standard `stderr` symbol via the preprocessor. This in turn didn't play
well with unity builds and caused curl tool to crash or stay silent due
to an uninitialized stderr. This was a hard to find issue, fixed by
manually breaking out one file from the unity sources.

To avoid two these two tricks, this patch implements a different
solution: Restore using our own local variable for our stderr output and
leave `stderr` as-is. To avoid using `stderr` by mistake, add a
`checksrc` rule (based on logic we already used in lib for `strerror`)
that detects any `stderr` use in `src` and points to using our own
variable instead: `tool_stderr`.

Follow-up to 06133d3e9b8aeb9e9ca0b3370c246bdfbfc8619e
Follow-up to 2f17a9b654121dd1ecf4fc043c6d08a9da3522db

Closes #11958

---

TOTEST: See how this work when running tests. There is no `UNITTEST` mode now, `tool_stderr` needs to be initialized to `stderr` for unittests. [PASSED]

issue.title: 8.4.0 failing compilation on "RUN checksrc" with "--enable-debug"

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

./configure --enable-debug --with-openssl
make

...
  CC       ../lib/libcurltool_la-version_win32.lo
  CC       ../lib/libcurltool_la-warnless.lo
  RUN      checksrc
  CC       ../lib/base64.o
  CC       ../lib/curl_multibyte.o
  CC       ../lib/dynbuf.o
  CC       ../lib/nonblock.o
  CC       ../lib/timediff.o
  CC       ../lib/version_win32.o
  CC       ../lib/strtoofft.o
  CC       ../lib/warnless.o
  CCLD     curl
./tool_stderr.c:62:1: warning: STDERR already disabled from line 35 (BADCOMMAND)
   /* !checksrc! disable STDERR 1 */
 ^
./tool_stderr.c:69:1: warning: STDERR already disabled from line 35 (BADCOMMAND)
   /* !checksrc! disable STDERR 1 */
 ^
./tool_stderr.c:35:18: warning: Unused ignore: STDERR (UNUSEDIGNORE)
   /* !checksrc! disable STDERR 1 */
                  ^
checksrc: 0 errors and 3 warnings
checksrc: 0 errors and 10 warnings suppressed
make[2]: *** [Makefile:2037: checksrc] Error 5


### I expected the following

successful build

### curl/libcurl version

curl 8.4.0

### operating system

archlinux

body:
Thanks everyone for reporting and fixing.
Is there an ETA when the new tarballs with be available?
@tawmoto From what I see in the latest git commits, a release 8.4.1 is currently being cut, so I would expect "very soon" ;)

This has not been decided. From my perspective, this is a rather minor build nuisance that might not in itself suffice to make us to a quick patch release. The fact that we work on 8.4.1 now is just because we just shipped 8.4.0 so if we don't merge any feature, the next release will become 8.4.1.

But I'm not ruling it out either.

thank you, Daniel.
any chance to update the tarballs to contain the missing file for 8.4.0?
We cannot modify a release, we can only do new releases.
